ygData.subject: Cantera 1.6.0
ygData.msgSnippet: I have just now posted at the sourceforge site a Windows binary installer for Cantera 1.6.0.  To the best of my knowledge, everything works, including all

I have just now posted at the sourceforge site a Windows binary 
installer for Cantera 1.6.0.  To the best of my knowledge, everything 
works, including all MATLAB and Python demos.

New features:

-  adiabatic, freely-propagating flames in Python.  See Python demo 
'adiabatic_flame.py'.  (Coming very soon to MATLAB, but not in this 
version.)
- class Mixture in Python and MATLAB for multiphase mixtures, and 
multiphase equilibrium. See the Python demos for examples with 
condensed phases.
- improved support for electrochemistry and fuel cell modeling (but 
still a work in progress).


Fixes / improvements:

- nasa.cti data file split into 2: nasa_gas.cti and nasa_condensed.cti.
- The ChemEquil equilibrium solver is now (again) more robust.  The 
problems some people encountered in version 1..5.5 should now be fixed.
- Some flame simulations should be faster now, due to removal of an 
unnecesary call to compute the viscosity.

To install it:
  - completely remove Cantera 1.5.5 or earlier from your system, 
including removing the Cantera folder from 
C:\python24\Lib\site-packages.
  - run Cantera160.msi
  - after it runs, run the Cantera Python installer in the Cantera 
installation folder.
  - If you alreadyy set environment variables, etc., appropriately for 
1.5..5, that should be all you need to do. Otherwise, follow the same 
steps as in the 1.5.5 installation documentation.

Please let me know if there are any problems!

Dave
